Hybrid Cloud Security Agent","description":"

                    With Kaspersky Hybrid Cloud Security, you can provision cybersecurity capabilities right inside your cloud workloads via Azure Extensions, keeping your always-on business apps safe and secure.

                    • Award-winning protection for files, web traffic, and containers in your Azure cloud.
                    • Powerful Application Startup Control providing reliable security by using configured rules to allow or block the startup of executable files, scripts, and MSI packages, or the loading of DLL modules onto Servers.
                    • File Integrity Monitoring controls the integrity of critical and system files while Log Inspection scans Windows event logs to ensure operational hygiene.
                    • Exploit Prevention relies on distributed mitigation techniques and controls processes, helping block advanced threats.
                    • Anti-Cryptor component protects shared networks folders against ransomware attacks.
                    • SIEM-integration allows increasing transparency and visibility across your entire corporate cloud environment.

                    We enable adaptive ecosystem and complement Microsoft Azure cloud's native capabilities with more protection layers, so you can be confident that your cloud assets are safeguarded at all times.

                    Support Details

                    Kaspersky Lab provides technical support to customers with a valid commercial or trial license. To receive technical support for your Kaspersky Lab product, you can refer to the articles in the Knowledge Base; look for an answer to your question on the forum; submit a request on the CompanyAccount portal. To read Support Service Terms and Conditions, follow the link.

                    If you still have any questions, please call us.

                    Virtual LoadMaster™ (VLM) is easily managed & deployed in Azure & delivers these core features: *

                    • Client authentication and single sign-on (SSO)
                    • Content switching/Traffic Management
                    • Global site traffic distribution (GSLB)
                    • Intuitive Web User Interface for administration & monitoring
                    • Layer 4-7 application load balancing, reverse proxy
                    • Layer 7 session persistence
                    • Native IPsec VPN for hybrid deployments
                    • Web Application Firewall (WAF) engine - Rules subscription option available
                    • PowerShell & RESTful API for automation
                    • Support for apps on both Basic and Standard tier virtual machines
                    • Support multiple workloads on single public IP
                    • SSL/TLS termination and re-encryption
                    • FIPS 140-2 Level 1
                    • Full HTTP/2 stack
                    *LoadMaster Subscription required to enable some features & services

                    KEMP Virtual LoadMaster is available in these license configurations

                    • BYOL - 30 day eval, performance based on license applied
                    • 20 Mbps Throughput / 50 SSL TPS Free
                    • 200 Mbps Throughput / 200 SSL TPS hourly
                    • 2000 Mbps Throughput / 1000 SSL TPS hourly
                    • 5000 Mbps Throughput / 10,000 TPS hourly
                    • 10 Gbps Throughput / 12,000 SSL TPS hourly
                    • 500 Mbps Throughput / 500 SSL TPS hourly With WAF Commercial Rules Subscription
                    • BYOL Long Term Support Release

                    Apply a paid license to the Free version to move to a supported, higher performance tier.


                    This version of Virtual LoadMaster, Load Balancer offers a 30 day trial, it can be licensed at 200Mbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps and 10Gbps. Customers can purchase perpetual licenses and feature subscriptions by visiting KEMP at https://kemptechnologies.com/kemp-sales/load-balancing-sales/. VLM delivers full Layer 4-7 load balancing, content switching, SSO, dual-factor and SAML authentication, Web Application Firewall, DNS failover, GSLB, reverse proxy, SSL offloading, SSL re-encryption, SSL acceleration, HTTP caching, compression & high availability for any Azure workload. VLM also enables hybrid deployments with built-in IPsec VPN and multi-site traffic steering.","publisherDisplayName":"KEMP Technologies                     Microsoft Antimalware for Azure Virtual Machines is a real-time protection capability that helps identify and remove viruses, spyware, and other malicious software, with configurable alerts when known malicious or unwanted software attempts to install itself or run on your system. The solution can be enabled and configured from the Azure Portal, Service Management REST API, and Microsoft Azure PowerShell SDK cmdlets.

                    To enable antimalware with the default configuration, click Create on the Add Extension blade without inputting any configuration setting values.

                    To enable antimalware with a custom configuration, input the supported values for the configuration settings provided on the Add Extension blade and click Create. Please refer to the tooltips provided with each configuration setting on the Add Extension blade to see the supported configuration values.

                    To enable antimalware event collection for a virtual machine, click any part of the Monitoring lens in the virtual machine blade, click Diagnostics command on Metric blade, select Status ON and check Windows Event system logs. The antimalware events are collected from the Windows Event system logs to your storage account. You can configure the storage account for your virtual machine to collect the antimalware events by selecting the appropriate storage account.

                    Service Map presents a view of your servers as you think of them - as interconnected systems that deliver services and rely on other technologies. Service Map discovers and maps server and process dependencies in real-time, without any predefinition, and visualizes application components, service dependencies, and supporting infrastructure configuration. This helps you eliminate the guesswork of problem isolation, identify surprise connections and broken links in your environment, and perform Azure Stack migrations knowing that critical systems and endpoints won't be left behind.

                    Diagnostic and Usage Data

                    Microsoft automatically collects usage and performance data through your use of the Service Map service. Microsoft uses this Data to provide and improve the quality, security and integrity of the Service Map service. Data includes information about the configuration of your software like operating system and version and also includes IP address, DNS name, and Workstation name in order to provide accurate and efficient troubleshooting capabilities. We do not collect names, addresses or other contact information.

                    For more information on data collection and usage, please see the Microsoft Online Services Privacy Statement.

                    This solution requires that the Azure Update and Configuration extension is also installed (for more information see this link) and that the Service Map is configured on the Azure subscription (for more information see the service map documentation)

                    This VM extension runs PerfInsights script that collects useful diagnostics information for troubleshooting IaaS performance issues on this Azure Stack VM. We recommend that you work with your Azure Stack Operator or your CSS contact to select the right performance scenario to help troubleshoot the performance issue you are having.

                    Based on the performance scenario, you might end up running one or more components mentioned below:

                    • Performance diagnostic traces for CPU, Disk and memory operations
                    • PerfMon for performance counters
                    • XPerf for advanced storage performance analysis
                    • Netmon traces for advanced network analysis: Network Monitor traces help detect problems on the network. Trace data contains network traffic information at the frame level and hence all non-encrypted data is visible in a trace.

                    This script will create a zip file that includes the collected log files and findings that will be uploaded to Microsoft support automatically or by you directly. Additionally, this data is uploaded to the specified storage account, shared using SAS (Shared Access Signatures) and available for download for 30 days. This data will be stored by Microsoft for a maximum of 90 days after your issue is resolved and will be used and retained consistent with the standards set forth at the Microsoft Trust Center.

                    Legal Terms: By clicking the create button I acknowledge that I have read and agree to the PerfInsights EULA.docx available inside PerfInsights download file and to share diagnostics information.

                    Please provide your comment or feedback at Azure Feedback

                    Custom Script Extension is a tool that can be used to automatically launch and execute VM customization tasks post configuration. When this Extension is added to a Virtual Machine, it can download Powershell scripts and files from Azure storage and launch a Powershell script on the VM which in turn can download additional software components. Custom Script Extension tasks can also be automated using the Azure Powershell cmdlets.

                    DSC is a management platform in Windows PowerShell that enables deploying and managing configuration data for software services and managing the environment in which these services run. Service Fabric is a distributed systems platform used to build scalable, reliable, and easily-managed applications for the cloud. You can use Service Fabric to

                    • Develop massively scalable, self-healing, applications that can be deployed in seconds.

                    • Simplify the design of your application and improve its reliability by using stateful and stateless micro-services.

                    • Easily monitor and diagnose the health of your applications and set policies for automatic repairs & upgrades.

                    This solution template requires you to also download the "Windows Server 2016 Datacenter" VM image.

Server 2017 Enterprise Windows Server 2016","description":"This image contains the full version of SQL Server 2017 Enterprise edition on Windows Server 2016. SQL Server 2017 represents a major step towards making SQL Server a platform that gives you choices of development languages, data types, on-premises or cloud, and operating systems by bringing the power of SQL Server to Linux, Linux-based Docker containers, and Windows. It provides comprehensive capabilities for mission-critical transactional processing, data warehousing, and real-time business intelligence. It includes the database engine with support for In-Memory transactional processing and analytics, automatic database tuning and new graph capabilities for modeling many-to-many relationships. This edition also includes Always On for +99.99% high availability and read scale-out capabilities. Various layers of protection, including innovative features like Always Encrypted and Row-Level Security for the highest data protection. SQL Server Machine Learning Services for integrated advanced analytics with Python and R language support. Includes Integration Services for moving and transforming data, Analysis Services for data mining, Reporting Services for web and mobile reports, and Master Data Services for data modeling. We recommend that you use a virtual machine size of DS13 or higher.

                    This image requires the SQL IaaS Extension, which must be downloaded separately.

AWS S3 compatible - Community Edition","description":"Bring Your Own License enabled.

                    With NooBaa, Cloud storage is not an either-or prospect. As capacity grows, lock-in to a specific technology or cloud vendor becomes a major business risk. NooBaa’s agile data fabric solves this problem by allowing customers to consume arbitrary capacity resources in datacenters or in the cloud and flexibly specify placement policies. The NooBaa Core, a machine learning and metadata engine running in Azure, learns resource attributes and optimizes data placement for best performance and economics

                    Features of the NooBaa hybrid archive include:

                    • Access Azure capacity through an Amazon-compatible S3 storage interface, enabling application compatibility regardless of resource choices.
                    • Seamlessly incorporates any on-premises host-based capacity; virtual or physical, any vendor, shared or dedicated
                    • Support for diverse network connectivity and dispersed WAN topologies
                    • Blends multiple public clouds into a single flexible fabric
                    • Capable of massive scale, tested to 20,000 nodes in a single system
                    • Deduplication, compression, and encryption, always on.
                    • 15 minute or less installation time is typical
                    • Run your AWS application in Azure without changing your code. 

                    NooBaa is designed for retention-oriented file-based workloads such as backup, archive, content repositories, Splunk archive, Hadoop, and other big-data workloads.

                     


                    NooBaa Hybrid Archive for Microsoft Azure is available with a Community Edition license that is free for use, including unlimited provisioned capacity, unlimited WAN and cloud locations, and up to 20TB of stored files. Components of the NooBaa system include the NooBaa Core (the control-plane and management system) and the NooBaa daemon (a user-space application that is installed on Linux or Windows hosts to incorporate them into the capacity fabric). When NooBaa is selected from the Microsoft Azure Marketplace, the NooBaa Core is automatically instantiated in an Azure VM environment. Customers may perform NooBaa Daemon installation directly from the management interface. Azure Blobstore is automatically configured as an optional storage target. A minimum of 3 storage nodes must be designated for reliable operation. Users may then designate data buckets and placement policies, and connect applications to the system using S3-style credentials. For operation of the system, customers will need to obtain an activation key from NooBaa at http://www.noobaa.com/community-edition/. For information on the NooBaa Enterprise Edition, customers may contact info@noobaa.com ","publisherDisplayName":"NooBaa","publisherIdentifier":"noobaa","provisioningState":"Succeeded","offer":"noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05","offerVersion":"22","sku":"pay-per-usage","billingPartNumber":"R65CBNLVR7YUTMBOGT737INIGP6RTEERIYO7UYI6WKEQVGPO4HQ4RS3KRLCCPTMW2FUDJVRBKSSYNTMWYXSNMTPLCDMV3CF4COUWSFA","galleryItemIdentity":"noobaa.noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05pay-per-usage.1.0.18","iconUris":{"hero":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/noobaa.noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05pay-per-usage-2.1.3/1b4f9ef223d144539e48f3398c92d177/Hero","large":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/noobaa.noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05pay-per-usage-2.1.3/d6b56e1a0cf54795939f7c83b0399352/Large","wide":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/noobaa.noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05pay-per-usage-2.1.3/fe4f42034ea849dfa0e81b01c607f4e8/Wide","medium":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/noobaa.noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05pay-per-usage-2.1.3/09cd86230ccd46b7b28d3c6dfb277177/Medium","small":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/noobaa.noobaa-hybrid-s3-archive-05pay-per-usage-2.1.3/dbeeb51ddbf64c85b6d2395b8512df36/Small"},"links":[{"displayName":"Getting Started Tutorial","uri":"https://goo.gl/aeTo0h"},{"displayName":"NooBaa Cloud Services","uri":"http://www.noobaa.com/"},{"displayName":"Register your community edition here","uri":"https://www.noobaa.com/azure_activation.html"},{"displayName":"NooBaa Partnerships information","uri":"https://www.noobaa.com/partners"}],"legalTerms":"

                    mPLAT Suite is a leading software as Multi-Cloud Management.

                    To resolve the issue of IT Silos in the cloud era, NRI offers a product called mPLAT Suite that can manage multi-cloud platforms including public clouds such as AWS, Azure, and GCP. In addition, it can streamline repetitive manual operations and workflows through runbook automation and essential IT service management. Moreover, mPLAT Suite employs a Single Pane of Glass Console that can integrate and visualize key information from any IT asset across any cloud or on-premise server in order to optimize all IT assets and make better analytical decisions. These three key components enable the successful IT digital transformation of most enterprises.

                    Highlights:
                    • A Single Pane of Glass through Web, Mobile, and CLI
                    • Monitor, Manage, Govern, and Provision multi-cloud and on-premise server
                    • Automation and job schedule by runbook with Job as a Code
                    • Identifies any application and infrastructure problem across the Multi-Cloud, and resolves it automatically through automated runbook
                    Licensing:

                    To deploy this image, you will need to use a template. See https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/documentation/81/virtualization/virtualization/set-up-the-vm-series-firewall-on-azure/deploy-the-vm-series-firewalls-on-azure-stack for important information.

                    The VM-Series for Azure natively analyzes all traffic in a single pass to determine the application identity, the content within, and the user identity. These business relevant elements are then used as integral components of your security policy, resulting in an improved security posture and a reduction in incident response time. Traffic flowing into, and across your Azure deployment is identified and secured based on the application identity, while sophisticated cyber threats detected within the application flows are prevented and web activity is strictly controlled with URL filtering. Policies can be user-based, granting access to applications based on the user need, their credentials, or their device type regardless their location. To help streamline management, a rich set of APIs can be used to integrate with external orchestration and management tools, collecting information related to workload changes which can then be used to dynamically drive policy updates. Panorama allows you to centrally manage your entire deployment of deployment of Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls both physical and virtualized form-factor.
                    The VM-Series bring your own license (BYOL) option allows you to pick and choose the VM-Series next generation firewall licenses, security subscriptions (Threat Prevention, WildFire, URL Filtering, GlobalProtect) and technical support that are appropriate for your needs. PAN-OS 8.0 includes networking performance enhancements and additional BYOL model options.

                    VM-Series for Azure can be used for protecting following deployments:

                  • Gateway for Internet facing applications
                  • Hybrid cloud
                  • Inter-Subnet between app-tiers
                  • VNET-to-VNET for larger deployments
                  • GlobalProtect for remote access security

                    PT Application Firewall is a smart protection solution that offers a serious response to the security challenges created by web portals, ERP and mobile applications.

                    It uses innovative security technologies to block attacks on both public-facing and internal applications, including injection attacks and application layer denial of service (DDoS).

                    Each user group — security staff, network administrators, developers, and SOC operators — has role-based access to data and the admin interface.

                    Highlights:

                    • Focus on major threats. Correlation mechanisms reduce the number of alerts and highlight important incidents. Attack chain metrics simplify forensics.

                    • Instant Blocking. Defends against “self-inflicted” vulnerabilities in custom-built software with virtual patches that protect apps until insecure code is fixed.

                    • Protection against security bypass. Prevents most firewall bypass methods including HPC, HPP and Verb Tampering.

                    • Behavioral analysis against robots. Automated malware protection prevents brute-force attacks, fraud, DDoS attacks, botnets, uncontrolled indexing, and data leakage.

                    • Evolving Security. Adapts to protect even the most dynamic applications that are constantly being refined and improved.


                    Positive Technologies Application Firewall (PT AF) is a Linux-based appliance that you can administer via web interface.

                    To get started, log in to the web interface at https://[DNS]:8443 or https://[PublicIP]:8443.

                    Default username: admin

                    Default password: positive

                    At your first login, you will be taken to the Setup Wizard.

                    Note. If you already activated your license in Azure Marketplace, you may skip the instruction below.

                    On the step License Management, activate your license:

                    1. In the Network License column, click the icon .
                    2. In the opened window, enter the unique 8-character code you received from your account manager at Positive Technologies.
                    3. Click Connect to Network License.

                    Once you are done, the information about your activated license will be displayed

                    Now you can configure the protection settings for your web application and HTTPS certificates.

                    For detailed instructions, refer to Getting Started or Administrator Guide.

                    PT AF is licensed under the Bring-Your-Own-License (BYOL) model. Request an evaluation license from Positive Technologies or purchase a license based on your requirements.

                    • Instant Blocking. Defends against “self-inflicted” vulnerabilities in custom-built software with virtual patches that protect apps until insecure code is fixed.
                    • Protection against security bypass. Prevents most firewall bypass methods including HPC, HPP, and Verb Tampering.
                    • Behavioral analysis against robots. Automated malware protection prevents brute-force attacks, fraud, DDoS attacks, botnets, uncontrolled indexing, and data leakage.
                    • Evolving Security. Adapts to protect even the most dynamic applications that are constantly being refined and improved.

                    This solution template requires you to also download the Positive Technology Virtual Machine (BYOL) image.


                    Getting started:

                    Positive Technologies Application Firewall (PT AF) is a Linux-based appliance that you can administer via web interface.

                    To get started, log in to the web interface at https://[DNS]:8443 or https://[PublicIP]:8443.

                    Default username: admin

                    Default password: positive

                    At your first login, you will be taken to the Setup Wizard.

                    Note. If you already activated your license in Azure Marketplace, you may skip the instruction below.

                    On the step License Management, activate your license:

                    1. In the Network License column, click the icon .
                    2. In the opened window, enter the unique 8-character code you received from your account manager at Positive Technologies.
                    3. Click Connect to Network License.

                    Once you are done, the information about your activated license will be displayed

                    Now you can configure the protection settings for your web application and HTTPS certificates.

                    For detailed instructions, refer to Getting Started or Administrator Guide.

                    PT AF is licensed under the Bring-Your-Own-License (BYOL) model. Request an evaluation license from Positive Technologies or purchase a license based on your requirements.

                    Powered by Rapid Recovery

                    Rapid Recovery advanced data protection unifies backup, replication and recovery in one easy-to-use software solution. The Rapid Recovery Core VM for Azure leverages the Microsoft cloud for snapshot backups and all the features of Rapid Recovery.

                    Efficient, Customizable Retention

                    Replication is WAN optimized and built on incremental block-based forever architecture, delivering efficient utilization of bandwidth. The VM can be configured to retain replicated backups for customizable intervals independent of the source. Replicated backups are immediately accessible.

                    Reliable Archive Creation

                    The Rapid Recovery Core VM supports Cloud archiving for long-term retention. The Cloud Connector integrates cloud storage into your retention process. Backups on the Rapid Recovery Core VM can be automatically archived in Azure.

                    Flexible Recovery

                    You can use a variety of convenient recovery methods and tools, ranging from bare-metal and object-level restore directly from Cloud, to the Microsoft Azure Import/Export service.


                    Quest provides a 14-day free evaluation license for the Rapid Recovery Core VM in Azure. After that time, a paid license must be purchased and installed on the VM.                     Remote Desktop Services (RDS) is the platform of choice to cost-effectively host Windows desktops and applications. This offering is designed to help you quickly create a RDS on IaaS deployment for testing and proof-of-concept purposes. Once set up, you can connect to the published desktops and applications from various platforms and devices, using the Microsoft Remote Desktop application on Windows, Mac, iOS and Android.


                    This deployment creates a small-footprint RDS deployment, with the following components: 1 domain controller VM (Windows Server 2012 R2); 2 RDS infrastructure VMs; N RDSH virtual machines; public IP address; and other required networking components. After completion, check the outputs section for final steps to complete and connect to your deployment!

                    For more information on customizing the deployment and making services HA, please see these RDS Azure Marketplace Steps

                    This solution template requires you to also download both Windows Server 2012 R2 and the Windows Server 2016.

Azure Application Connection Gateway","description":"Bring Your Own License enabled.
                    NetFoundry's software-only Azure connectivity solution provides:
                    • Zero Trust, encrypted Azure connections with app level micro-segmentation
                    • 3x the throughput of VPNs
                    • On-demand networking with simple usage-based SaaS pricing (like Azure)
                    • Bi-directional certificate validation for each device you add to your NetFoundry network
                    • Integrated firewall with protection against man in the middle, DoS and DDoS attacks
                    • Endpoint software to connect users directly from laptops and tablets (mobile coming soon)
                    • Endpoint software to connect IoT devices and IoT gateways
                    • Endpoint software to connect branches and sites
                    Add the NetFoundry Azure gateway to your network in minutes via our web console or via your DevOps tools such as Terraform (using NetFoundry APIs). Leverage your existing Internet connections and optimize your Azure app connectivity without disrupting your WAN.

                    As Azure does for infrastructure, NetFoundry provides your app connections as a fully managed service, empowering you to control your networks without managing the underlying infrastructure.

                    • Your controllers are hosted in the NetFoundry cloud and operated by you via web console and API.
                    • NetFoundry's managed Internet overlay backbone helps enable real-time, dynamic quality optimization between your endpoints and Azure, and is managed by NetFoundry as part of your service.
                    NetFoundry's software-only solution doesn't require you to use certain hardware or network providers. NetFoundry runs on top of any WAN or Internet connection, in a zero trust architecture, providing app-level control and micro-segmentation, enabling you to simply and securely extend your network to Azure from anywhere.
                    Deploy secure, high performance, global networks as easily and effectively as you spin up your Azure virtual machines. Choose login username "nfadmin" when creating your virtual machine.                     NetFoundry's software-only Azure connectivity solution provides:
                    • Zero Trust, encrypted Azure connections with app level micro-segmentation
                    • 3x the throughput of VPNs
                    • On-demand networking with simple usage-based SaaS pricing (like Azure)
                    • Bi-directional certificate validation for each device you add to your NetFoundry network
                    • Integrated firewall with protection against man in the middle, DoS and DDoS attacks
                    • Endpoint software to connect users directly from laptops and tablets (mobile coming soon)
                    • Endpoint software to connect IoT devices and IoT gateways
                    • Endpoint software to connect branches and sites
                    Add the NetFoundry Azure gateway to your network in minutes via our web console or via your DevOps tools such as Terraform (using NetFoundry APIs). Leverage your existing Internet connections and optimize your Azure app connectivity without disrupting your WAN.

                    As Azure does for infrastructure, NetFoundry provides your app connections as a fully managed service, empowering you to control your networks without managing the underlying infrastructure.

                    • Your controllers are hosted in the NetFoundry cloud and operated by you via web console and API.
                    • NetFoundry's managed Internet overlay backbone helps enable real-time, dynamic quality optimization between your endpoints and Azure, and is managed by NetFoundry as part of your service.
                    NetFoundry's software-only solution doesn't require you to use certain hardware or network providers. NetFoundry runs on top of any WAN or Internet connection, in a zero trust architecture, providing app-level control and micro-segmentation, enabling you to simply and securely extend your network to Azure from anywhere.
                    Deploy secure, high performance, global networks as easily and effectively as you spin up your Azure virtual machines. Choose login username "nfadmin" when creating your virtual machine.                     The Need For Customer Key Control

                    Microsoft Azure offers data-at-rest encryption and key management. But data protection mandates require that keys be stored and managed by customers. Microsoft Azure "Bring Your Own Key" (BYOK) services fulfills these requirements enabling customer key control. Customer key control allows for the separation, creation, ownership and control, including revocation, of encryption keys.

                    Multi-Cloud Key Life Cycle Management

                    CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager reduces key management complexity and operational costs by giving customers lifecycle control of encryption keys with centralized management and visibility.

                    Strong Encryption Key Security

                    Customer key control presents requirements for secure key generation and storage. CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager leverages the security of the Vormetric Data Security Manager to create keys and store them with FIPS 140-2 security. With the requirement for key security mechanisms such as safe storage of cloud backup keys, CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager acts as a key escrow for Microsoft Azure and provides full key metadata control both during upload and for keys in use.

                    Delivering Enhanced IT Efficienty

                    CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager offers multiple capabilities in support of enhanced IT efficiency:
                    • Centralized Key Management gives you access to each cloud provider from a single browser window, including across multiple accounts or subscriptions
                    • Automated key rotation offers both IT efficiency and enhanced data security
                    • Federated login provides the simplest mechanism for granting user access to key data. Cloud service logins are authenticated and authorized by Microsoft Azure – no login database nor AD or LDAP configuration is required.
                    • Access to all cloud providers from a single web tab, with key operations in the language of the cloud provider.

                    The Compliance Tools You Need

                    CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager cloud-specific logs and prepackaged reports offer fast compliance reporting. Logs may also be directed to a syslog server or SIEM.

                    Microsoft Azure Stack Support

                    CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager is also available for Microsoft Azure Stack, the leading hybrid cloud solution.

                    Learn More

                    Visit www.thalesesecurity.com/cckm for more information.
                    This edition of CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager supports key management for Salesforce, AWS, Azure Stack and Azure Key Vault","publisherDisplayName":"Thales eSecurity","publisherIdentifier":"thales-vormetric","provisioningState":"Succeeded","offer":"ciphertrust-ckm","offerVersion":"30","sku":"ciphertrust-ckm","billingPartNumber":"","galleryItemIdentity":"thales-vormetric.ciphertrust-ckmciphertrust-ckm.1.0.10","iconUris":{"large":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/thales-vormetric.ciphertrust-ckmciphertrust-ckm-1.0.4/b3ade627c7064d6090656d6ed169a2ba/Large","wide":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/thales-vormetric.ciphertrust-ckmciphertrust-ckm-1.0.4/d91f1e95cfd641038c7be5eef08155d9/Wide","medium":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/thales-vormetric.ciphertrust-ckmciphertrust-ckm-1.0.4/ee96d757218641d5b244b5a22e2b0f5e/Medium","small":"https://azurebridgerp.blob.northwest.azs-longhaul-02.selfhost.corp.microsoft.com:443/producticons/thales-vormetric.ciphertrust-ckmciphertrust-ckm-1.0.4/b9c2ff49c8a642dfb0672758b07e9c66/Small"},"links":[{"displayName":"Learn about Thales e-Security","uri":"https://www.thalesesecurity.com/about-us"},{"displayName":"Understanding Encryption Choices","uri":"https://www.thalesesecurity.com/products/data-encryption/selecting-the-right-encryption-approach"},{"displayName":"Vormetric Transparent Encryption","uri":"https://www.thalesesecurity.com/products/data-encryption/vormetric-data-security-platform"},{"displayName":"CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager Web Page","uri":"https://www.thalesesecurity.com/products/key-management/ciphertrust-cloud-key-manager"}],"legalTerms":"THALES E-SECURITY, INC.                     ZeroDown® Software technology provides businesses with continuous access to their company data via their Business Continuity as a Service (BCaaS)™ architecture, protecting applications, and transactions in the event of network interruptions that would normally cripple the enterprise. They make this environment accessible through their Patented BCaaS™ system, lowering barriers to entry on cloud applications and infrastructure by eliminating downtime.
                    The downtime risks of cloud-based solutions mirror those of traditional IT systems: unplanned outages, failure of storage availability architectures, VMs, or servers. Application migration processes can introduce additional burdens including service interruptions, loss of in-flight transactions, configuration, synch up, and performance issues. Since disaster recovery systems can take days to restore critical services and in-flight data may never be recaptured, DR is clearly not the answer. Nor are outsourced hosting agreements any guarantee of uptime. True business continuity requires the capability to process active-active critical applications in multiple availability zones across different clouds or platforms. ZeroDown’s patented technology provides this simple, easy and secure solution to ensure that applications are up and running continuously. All application instances are hot, making everything equally and simultaneously available across multiple locations in real time. If one instance goes down, the others will continue to function with no customer impacts or operational disruptions. Since live transactions and data are being synched up continuously, applications can be rolled back to any available site, providing the optimal business continuity solution for multi-cloud deployments.
